intro: Ruellia yucatana, commonly known as Yucatan bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking blue-violet flowers in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Ruellia yucatana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
